intro: Diplazium magofukui, commonly known as the Japanese serrate wood fern, is a species of fern native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Dennstaedtiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine in some regions. The leaves are bi-lobed and have a leathery texture, contributing to its ornamental value.
